title: On Thursday the Meat King market sold 210 pounds of ground beef. On Friday they sold twice that amount. On Saturday they only sold 130 pounds. How much more meat did they sell on Friday than Saturday? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, to figure this whole question out, we first need to find out how much ground beef was sold on Friday. If Friday sold double Thursday’s amount (210), we can multiply it by 2 and find that 420 pounds of ground beef were sold on Friday. The next part of the problem is figuring out how much more meat was sold on Friday than Saturday. Since we know 420 pounds of meat was sold on Friday, we can subtract Saturday’s total (130) and find that 290 more pounds of meat were sold on Friday than Saturday.
